channel.title: Skateboarding
channel.description:
ight well, i am new to skateboarding, and i've only being using the shitty toys r us skateboards. so far, i've only accomplished a 2-3 inch ollie off the ground, and i wear etnies to i am good with that. But i am looking for a pro skateboard, and i just want opinions on a good starter brand that isn't expensive as hell like element and all those other big ones, and i can't seem to find a good retailer other than on the web around were i live. Any opinions on a good brand?
Also, if this helps.
I am 6'0. 170 pounds and i am 13.
(i am not fat, i am only about 10 pounds overweight and that isn't that bad.)

item.title: Skateboarding
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:39, topic:223242”]A friend of mine had a skateboard that was made of some fiber stuff, if you touched it your hands started to itch really bad.[/quote]really… because with everything they add in decks (including fiberlights, which is what i think you’re talking about) you can’t really get enough fiberglass to make anything itch. Either you’re lying or their is something wrong with the deck.

That’s what I used to ride. I skated for 2 or 3 days but found it boring so I sold it to a friend.[/quote]

item.title: Skateboarding
item.dc:creator: @zammyking111 zammyking111
item.description:
@zammyking111 wrote:

I can say since I skate I would go to a local skate shop, and I would buy probably buy…

Zero Deck
Reds (Bearings)
Any Wheels (Doesn’t Matter)
Grip (Black Magic, Mob) Avoid Jessup
Venture Trucks

Thats a good setup for a beginner, zero boards are great to learn on. If you want high pop go with Chocolates.

Read full topic

item.title: Skateboarding
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

ABEC 5’s are a must really they make the board move so smoothly its just amazing. As for deck theres a lot of leniance there because its what you feel comfortable with some people prefer weight some prefer it to be agile its all down to your style of skateboarding. But world industries are some great boards(or were when i last did skateboarding) so if you can get one of those

Read full topic

item.title: Skateboarding
item.dc:creator: @Andrew Andrew
item.description:
@Andrew wrote:

Alright, first off I ride Element, and they aren’t shit. If you want a good starter board get a World Industries. To get your ollies higher bring your front foot up more. Also, who gives a sh*t if you get around the bad kids, just ignore them. Ya they’ll ask you to smoke with them, ya they’ll ask you to drink with them. Just be like “no wai dude, already had like 6 packs today”. Also, PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE. For the sake of god. Do not wear girl pants.

Edit: You might be like me, when I first started off I stuck to no risers and small wheels. Way easier to kickflip for me.

Read full topic

item.title: Skateboarding
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

Removed my old post and reposted all together. i did bad quoting it looked like crap.

[quote=“TR3V0R, post:6, topic:223242”][quote author=Rubiks Cube link=topic=293217.msg2360503#msg2360503 date=1217565972]
dont skateboard it will get you in with bad people. switch to longboards way more fun. and 2 - 3 inches is horrible not matter the board. if you just handed me a skateboard now i could atleast do a foot off the ground. google Sector 9 and there are longboards.
[/quote]

I hate when people say that. Skateboarding doesn’t get you in with bad people.[/quote]
I <3 Tr3vor. He speaks the truth.

I started off unsure of everything too because i live in a town where no one does anything but farm corn (Northwest Indiana). I started off with a Berkley element, the thing was good enough to skate, but it won’t hold up once you get better. all really depends on how well you treat your deck and your skill level. i mean, once you get good enough i would say go with enjoi, girl or zoo york. they all have different stuff going on with them, but they all hold up pretty well. ive been rollin on this enjoi for a pretty long while now. Btw, if anyone tells you alien workshop sucks, they LIES. one of my favorite decks was my last alien workshop, that thing help up like that ugly guy from the goonies under that cave door ^-^ anywho, once you get a little better, you’ll learn to cope with more comfortable things and apply it to what you think is stronger and such. ollies aren’t gonna do much to your deck

Read full topic
